voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
This lesson focuses on expressing daily activities in Japanese.
Firstly, we're going to talk about expressing "I'm" in Japanese which is translated. The phrase "I'm" is translated as

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
which means "I'm"
Let's turn that into a full sentence and say "I'm cooking". In Japanese, we say:

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は料理しています・わたしはりょうりしています

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
in Japanese.
Moving on to express "I'm going to", it translates to

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は...に行きます・わたしは...にいきます

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . For example, if you're about to say, "I'm going to the park":

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は公園に行きます・わたしはこうえんにいきます

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Repeat, "I'm going to the park" in Japanese is:

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Finally, we'll learn how to say "I want to" in Japanese. The phrase 'I want to' is

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は...がほしい・わたしは...がほしい

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . For instance, to say "I want to sleep", you can say:

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は寝るがほしい・わたしはねるがほしい

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
in Japanese.
In this lesson, you have learned how to express "I'm", "I'm going to" and "I want to" for discussing daily activities in Japanese.
